title: Creating an Inequality
text: First, we must transfer the word problem into an inequality that represents the amount of Marlon's monthly TV bill.

title: Creating an Inequality
text: We know that Marlon wants his monthly TV bill to be less than or equal to $100, and his bill consists of a fixed charge of $$\$49.99$$ per month and an additional $$\$5.49$$ for each first-run movie. If we let $$x$$ represent the number of first-run movies Marlon purchases, then the total amount of his TV bill would be $$49.99+5.49x$$. Therefore, we get the inequality $$49.99+5.49x \leq 100$$.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: Now, we must solve the inequality for $$x$$ by algebrically manipulating it.

title: Solving the Inequality
text: To isolate $$x$$, we can subtract $$49.99$$ from both sides and then divide both sides by $$5.49$$. We now have $$x \leq 9.109$$ as our inequality.

title: Creating a Sentence-Answer
text: Since $$x$$ must be less than or equal to $$9.109$$ and $$x$$ has to be a whole number, what is the maximum number of first-run movies Jake can watch?
